DOC.brief_summary: This trial compare outcome treatment mild moderate asthma : inhaled tiotropium bromide versus placebo .
DOC.brief_title: Study Investigate Effect Inhaled Tiotropium Bromide Neurokinin-A Induced Bronchoconstriction Patients With Mild-to-moderate Asthma
DOC.criteria: Informed consent Male female , least 18 year old Documented medical history asthma ( diagnosis least 6 month ago ) Nonsmoker least stop 1 year ( case smoke earlier : maximum 10 packyears ) Able conduct technically acceptable spirometry , methacholine neurokininA provocation test . At visit 1 : PC20 methacholine ≤ 8 mg/ml AND ≤ 3.3x107 mol/ml neurokininA provocation test . At visit 1 : force expiratory value one second > = 80 % predict value . Female subject may get pregnant use adequate contraception . Airway infection within 6 week prior first study visit . Other respiratory disease ( eg COPD , lung cancer , etc . ) Participating another clinical trial . Clinically relevant systemic disease , asthma . Clinically significant laboratory deviation . Alcohol drug abuse . Female subject lactate .
